news.title: India’s REIT-ready office stock crosses 415 million sq ft: Economic Survey
news.para: India's commercial real estate is seeing deeper institutionalisation. Over 415 million sq ft of office space is REIT-eligible. Small and medium REITs are emerging as a new investment avenue. REITs continue to operate under a tax pass-through framework.

news.title: Outstanding individual home loans jump nearly four times to ₹37 lakh crore at March-end 2025: Survey
news.para: Outstanding individual housing loans have surged to over Rs 37 lakh crore by March 2025. This represents a rise in home loans as a percentage of GDP to over 11 percent. Government policies and initiatives have supported this expansion. Housing sales have also increased post-pandemic.

news.title: Treating wastewater can unlock market worth ₹3.2 lakh crore by 2047: Economic Survey
news.para: India's urban growth faces a new economic opportunity: the circular water economy. The Economic Survey 2025-26 highlights treating wastewater as a resource. This shift could create a market worth lakhs of crore by 2047. It also promises over one lakh jobs. Reusing treated water will secure freshwater for essential needs and drive urban development.

news.title: Economic survey calls for "holistic rethink" of development control regulations
news.para: As India's urban centers navigate a pivotal moment, the Economic Survey 2025-26 highlights the urgent need for a transformative shift in city management. A newly proposed fund promises to invigorate competition in urban funding, prompting cities to embrace market-oriented financial strategies.

news.title: Supply of affordable housing plummets to just 17% in 2025: Economic Survey
news.para: In India's bustling urban centers, affordable housing is becoming increasingly elusive. Properties priced below ₹50 lakh are dwindling, putting immense pressure on low-income families who struggle to find a roof over their heads. While developers are shifting their focus to the outskirts of cities, these new developments often fall short on essential amenities and transport links.

news.title: Centre notifies solid waste management rules; applicable from April 1
news.para: On April 1, new regulations for Solid Waste Management will kick in, requiring everyone to adopt a four-stream waste segregation system from the outset. For those generating substantial waste, clear-cut responsibilities for waste management have been established.

news.title: Steady demand, intense competition to cap paints sector growth at 3-5%: Crisil
news.para: As we look ahead to FY26 and FY27, the Indian paint industry is poised for a modest growth trajectory, estimated at 3-5%. Despite constant demand from housing and automotive sectors, companies grapple with heightened competition and pricing challenges that temper profits. Operating margins are projected to stabilize at 15%.

news.title: Ajmera Realty's net profit declines 24.64% in Q3 FY26
news.para: In the December 2025 quarter, Ajmera Realty & Infra India experienced a downturn with a net profit decrease of over 24%, alongside a dip in total income. Nonetheless, for the first three quarters of FY26, the company has achieved 72% rise in sales value.

news.title: Brookfield REIT's net operating income up 14% in Q3 FY26
news.para: Brookfield REIT reported a robust 14% rise in year-over-year net operating income in Q3 FY26. The company announced distributions of ₹5.40 per unit. A notable surge in leasing activity was recorded, with a remarkable 1.2 million square feet leased.

news.title: Four crore pucca houses built for poor in last decade: President
news.para: Over the last ten years, the government has successfully constructed 40 million robust homes for the underprivileged. In the previous year alone, 3.2 million new residences were delivered to families in need.

news.title: China reportedly drops rules that sparked property crisis, developer shares surge
news.para: China has lifted its 'three red lines' restrictions for property developers, marking a significant step to alleviate the financial strain burdening the real estate market. Banks now have the flexibility to extend loans for up to five years on specific projects, a welcome respite for many developers.

news.title: Apartments in Mangaluru convert wet waste into compost, generate income
news.para: Apartment complexes in Mangaluru are embracing sustainable waste management by converting wet waste into organic compost using advanced machines and traditional vermicomposting. This initiative reduces landfill waste, generates revenue for resident associations, and offers benefits like reduced odour and pest issues, with some complexes even receiving tax discounts.

news.title: Building owners in Wayanad left out of rehabilitation efforts
news.para: Building owners in Wayanad's Chooralmala and Mundakkai are still awaiting government compensation 1.5 years after a devastating landslide destroyed their properties. Despite facing financial distress and receiving property tax notices for destroyed buildings, they remain excluded from rehabilitation efforts, impacting their livelihoods and loan repayments.

news.title: ASK Property Fund pours ₹260 crore in Kreeva’s south Delhi luxury housing project
news.para: ASK Property Fund has invested Rs 260 crore in Kreeva, the real estate venture of Kanodia Group. Kreeva has acquired a prime land parcel in South Delhi for a luxury residential project. This development will offer spacious apartments in a market known for independent floors. ASK Property Fund sees significant opportunities in the NCR real estate market.

news.title: Anchor Group feud nears resolution as Mehul Shah emerges top bidder for GreatWhite
news.para: A family dispute over control of GreatWhite Global is nearing resolution as Mehul Shah emerges as the successful bidder to acquire his brother Hemang Shah's 50% stake. The National Company Law Tribunal has directed both parties to expedite the conclusion of the bidding process, with a hearing scheduled for March 6.

news.title: Easy Home Finance secures $30 million from Investcorp, Claypond Capital, SMBC Asia
news.para: Speaking with ET, founder Rohit Chokhani said the funds will primarily be used to grow the loan book and expand its network in smaller towns. Founded in 2017, Easy Home Finance operates an app-based lending platform which has automated applications, underwriting, and loan management.

news.title: Lucknow development body floats 27-storey luxury housing project in Aishbagh
news.para: Lucknow Development Authority has approved Aishbagh Square, a 27-storey luxury residential complex featuring 384 flats. The project, located near Charbagh railway station, will offer 3-BHK apartments starting at Rs 1.11 crore. Registration opens January 29, with allotment via lottery and possession expected within five years.

news.title: Uttar Pradesh housing department forms panel for second phase of ease of rules drive
news.para: The UP housing department has formed a six-member committee to implement the second phase of compliance reduction and deregulation. This move follows the success of the first phase. The committee will identify bottlenecks in application processing for individuals and private players. The goal is to improve the working ecosystem for all stakeholders and streamline turnaround times for approvals and clearances.

news.title: Surat-based diamond and real estate group faces I-T department search
news.para: The Income Tax Department has launched a major search operation targeting a prominent Surat-based diamond manufacturer and real estate developer. Searches are underway at multiple locations across India, including Surat, Mumbai, Bengaluru, and New Delhi. The investigation focuses on undisclosed earnings from their real estate ventures. The group also has significant interests in education and global diamond businesses.

news.title: No new affordable housing projects in two years, Gurugram & Faridabad buyers priced out
news.para: Affordable housing in Gurgaon and Faridabad is becoming a distant dream for middle-class families as new project launches have stalled. Rising land and construction costs have made it difficult for developers to build within the government's price cap, leading to a near-freeze in approvals and leaving many aspiring homeowners locked out of the market.
